Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery ring-aryballos; very worn; exterior: inside ring hole, traces of black; around ring hole, traces of narrow and wide painted black concentric bands with incised lines across the wide bands; around edge, black-figure decoration consisting of horse riders (only incision marks and traces of black remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA183 and Ure Museum 26.2.4. The sherd is also published in Ure, P. ‘Ring Aryballoi’, Hesperia: The Journal of the American School of Classical Studies at Athens 15.1, January - March 1946, 41, pl. 10, no. 39.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 11, pl. VI, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.140) (Phase 1)
